intro: Mouroucoa barbigera, commonly known as the hairy mouroucoa, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
